translation.text: Central Coast & Newcastle Line - Partial Closure

A limited bus service is operating between Morisset and Newcastle Interchange in both directions due to severe weather conditions causing flooding at Cockle Creek.

At this stage, there is no forecast on when the line can reopen. Please delay any non-essential travel or make your own arrangements if possible. If you must travel, listen to announcements, check information screens and transport apps for updates as departure platforms may change and allow plenty of additional travel time.

Buses replace trains between Newcastle Interchange, Maitland and Scone/Dungog due to severe weather conditions causing flooding at Sandgate.

At this stage, there is no forecast on when the line can reopen.

Please  avoid any non-essential travel, make your own arrangements or if travelling - allow plenty of extra travel time.

Major delays due to an incident involving an empty train at Revesby and flooding of the line at Bardwell Park. There are large service gaps and services may not operate to timetable. 

Shuttle train services are operating between Central and Kingsgrove in both directions and also between Macarthur and East Hills in both directions. A limited bus service is operating between Kingsgrove and Glenfield in both directions.

Please consider postponing or delaying your journey, if you must travel please allow plenty of additional travel time. Listen to announcements and check information screens for service changes.

With ongoing rainfall being experienced and heavy falls predicted in some areas, train services and station facilities may be impacted on some lines. Before you travel please check Transport apps for up-to-date train running information. Also be weather wise and avoid rushing in wet weather to prevent slips, trips and falls.

AFL - GWS Giants V St Kilda - GIANTS Staidum, Sydney Olympic Park
15:20 to 17:30 
- The closest station to Sydney Showground Stadium is Olympic Park
- Trains run from Lidcombe to Olympic Park every 10 minutes until late.

A League: Double Header- Jets v Adelaide & Phoenix v Roar- McDonald Jones Stadium, Broadmeadow
Wellington Phoenix V Brisbane Road - Kick off at 16:05
Newcastle Jets V Adelaide United- Kick off at 18:45
- The closest station to McDonald Jones Stadium is Broadmeadow on the Central Coast & Newcastle Line. From the station, the stadium is approximately a 15-20 minute walk away.

NRL: Sharks v Raiders - Netstrata Jubilee Stadium, Kogarah
18:15 to 20:15
- The closest station to Netstrata Jubilee Stadium is Carlton on the T4 Eastern Suburbs & Illawarra Line. The stadium is a 10 minute walk from the station via Jubilee Avenue.

NBL - Sydney Kings V Cairns Taipans - Qudos Bank Arena, Sydney Olympic Park
16:45 to 19:10 
- The closest station to Sydney Showground Stadium is Olympic Park
- Trains run from Lidcombe to Olympic Park every 10 minutes until late

NRL: West Tigers V Roosters- Campbelltown Sports Staidum, Leumeah
16:05 to 18:00
- The closest station to Campbelltown Sports Stadium is Leumeah on the the T8 Airport & South Line.The stadium is a short 100m walk from the station.

Summer in the Domain - The Domain, Art Gallery Road
17:00 to 22:00
- The closest stations to The Domain are Martin Place, St James and Circular Quay which are within walking distance of the Domain.

For details, please visit https://transportnsw.info/events/2021/03

Green Square, Mascot, Domestic Airport, International Airport, Wolli Creek, Turrella, Bardwell Park, Bexley North, Kingsgrove, Beverly Hills, Narwee, Riverwood, Padstow, Revesby, Panania, East Hills, Holsworthy due to an incident involving an empty train at Revesby. From Central this service will stop all stations to Macarthur via Strathfield and Granville. 

Allow plenty of additional travel time.
Macdonaldtown, Newtown, Stanmore, Petersham, Lewisham, Summer Hill due to a train requiring mechanical repairs at Burwood earlier.

Padstow, Riverwood, Narwee, Beverly Hills, Kingsgrove, Bexley North, Bardwell Park, Turrella due to an incident involving an empty train at Revesby. A limited bus service is operating between Glenfield and Kingsgrove in both directions.
Macdonaldtown, Newtown, Stanmore, Petersham, Lewisham, Summer Hill, Croydon due to a train requiring mechanical repairs at Burwood earlier.
Shellharbour Junction due to signal equipment repairs at Dapto earlier.
Ashfield due to a train requiring mechanical repairs at Burwood earlier.

Morisset Due to severe weather conditions causing flooding at Cockle Creek.  Buses replace trains between Morisset and Newcastle Interchange in both directions
 
A train service will operate between Newcastle Interchange and Broadmeadow only.
Wollongong due to signal equipment repairs at Dapto earlier.

Campbelltown due to an incident involving an empty train at Revesby. A limited bus service is operating between Glenfield and Kingsgrove in both directions.

A bus replacement service will be operating between Bathurst and Lithgow.

Please allow additional travel time.

Please see station staff for alternative transport.

Allow additional travel time.
The lift between George Street and the concourse is temporarily out of service. If you require assistance, please ask staff or phone 9379 4110.
The lift between the concourse and platform 2/3 is temporarily out of service. If you require assistance, please ask staff or call 9752 8734.
The lift between the concourse and Railway Parade is temporarily out of service. If you require assistance, please ask staff or call 9563 7612.
The lift between platforms 1/2 and the footbridge is temporarily out of service. If you require assistance, please ask staff or call 4349 9110.
The lift between the concourse and Station street is temporarily out of service. If you require assistance, please ask staff or phone 9752 8431.
The lift between the concourse and Jane Street is temporarily out of service. If you require assistance, please ask staff or phone 4780 3819.
Station Update - Beverly Hills, Kingsgrove, Narwee and more

Due to an incident involving an empty train at Revesby, limited buses will operate between Kingsgrove and Glenfield in both directions as trains are suspended. Please consider postponing or delaying your journey, if you must travel allow plenty of additional travel time.
Due to platform renewal work, please take extra care while on the platform and stand behind the yellow line prior to boarding your train.

From 11 January to end-December 2021, the escalators and staircase connecting the corner of Pitt Street and Eddy Avenue with the Grand Concourse and L1 Light Rail stop will be closed due to station upgrade works. 

To access the Grand Concourse and Platforms 1 to 12 from the street level, please use the Western Forecourt entry via Pitt Street. To access Platforms 16 to 25 from the street level, please use the Eddy Avenue entry. 

To access Pitt Street or Eddy Avenue from the Grand Concourse or L1 light rail stop, please exit the station via the Western Forecourt or Northern Concourse.

There are changes happening at Central Station due to Sydney Metro construction works. Access to certain areas of the station and platforms may mean using different stairs, escalators and lifts. Please follow the signs and staff directions. If you need assistance, see station staff. For detailed information please visit https://transportnsw.info/alerts/details#/6049959
Due to station redevelopment work some platforms have reduced capacity. Please avoid standing in front of construction zones and remain behind the yellow line on the platform

Platforms 4, 5 & 6 upgrade works. A new Metro concourse is being constructed on the northern end of Sydenham Station. While the concourse is being installed, please board and alight from the first 5 carriages of the train on platforms 4 & 6 and the last 6 carriages of the train on platform 5. If you need help, please ask staff at the station. For more information on these upgrades, please see sydneymetro.info
